item.title: Meteorological Observation Systems
item.description: Synoptic weather observations Synoptic weather observations are observations of the atmosphere that are made at regular intervals, typically every three or six hours, at a global network of weather stations. These observations are used by meteorologists to create weather maps and forecasts. Synoptic weather observations typically include the following elements: Temperature: The air temperature at the time of the observation. Dew point: The temperature at which the air would become saturated with water vapor and condensation would occur.
